document.title: TEXAS ESSENTIAL KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS FOR PHYSICAL EDUCATION

33789793F8264FC28FFF8994CE3F496D.description: participate in self-selected physical activities for personal enjoyment.

AF711875C64048ED9E42FF2820A42BF6.description: implement a plan using available technology to participate in moderate to vigorous physical activity for a sustained period of time on a regular basis; and

B5454BEBBE234CB3B1DDF3A647E4A6AB.description: Lifetime wellness--application of lifetime wellness. The physically literate student identifies the value of lifetime wellness. The student is expected to:

8CF7E48D70B849DD9C8C48ED15D24F10.description: Social and emotional health--accepting and providing constructive feedback. The physically literate student accepts and provides constructive feedback. The student is expected to provide constructive feedback to peers using a positive tone to improve performance.

AE2BBAE532F646DDAB33A205C1843C4C.description: Social and emotional health--perseverance. The physically literate student perseveres while addressing challenges. The student is expected to develop and apply a plan of action and make effective decisions when faced with challenges, obstacles, or difficulties during game situations and sports.

D8C7E2E329A0412BAC17E21C8FBF8C8A.description: demonstrate empathy and mutual respect for the feelings of others.

31EF77BFAFE14F17AD96D23A6E0F137D.description: communicate effectively to enhance healthy interactions while settling disagreements; and

235910D54DC34B5CBB8D1635438EC61C.description: discuss the importance of and resolve conflict, without cue, in socially acceptable ways, and respond to winning and losing with dignity and understanding;

8D88DD0336194472B28E23DDF3348027.description: Social and emotional health--resolving conflict and social interaction. The physically literate student demonstrates competency in resolving conflict and social interaction. The student is expected to:

F6B31475613C4E67A26E512647DEAB8A.description: evaluate self-management skills to demonstrate self-control of impulses and emotions, without cue, during games, situations, and sports.

66C2C4CAB41C4CB2998D073BFBA13E18.description: discuss the importance of and demonstrate respect for differences and similarities in abilities of self and others during game situations and sports; and

5900B168AA164F37BBCE0333D5C4D08D.description: Social and emotional health--personal responsibility and self-management. The physically literate student demonstrates competency in personal responsibility. The student is expected to:

4A5E4DA9BFD7477DB5ABC69548EF1A77.description: perform, without cue, the correct safety precautions, including pedestrian, water, sun, cycling, skating, and scooter safety.

0E74104EA2AF4AEAA09996A0A9B9BBDC.description: perform, without cue, the selection and use of proper attire and safety equipment that promote safe participation and prevent injury in dynamic activities, games, and sports; and

8453B57614BA4547B9D9210527B077A7.description: Health, physical activity, and fitness--environmental awareness and safety practices. The physically literate student demonstrates competency in environmental awareness and understands safety practices. The student is expected to:

D46909F1210C4AF5955C500A8D92A239.description: determine hydration needs, without cue, based on physical performance and environmental factors.

740E73467AC74C39B78DF0F1F0710E1E.description: develop a healthy food choice plan that enhances physical performance; and

BE81FEE8704545ECB81B459844614A8F.description: Health, physical activity, and fitness--nutrition and hydration. The physically literate student recognizes the correlation between nutrition, hydration, and physical activity. The student is expected to:

F9137D1555794049ADB8057CF1C735A2.description: evaluate personal fitness goals and make appropriate changes for improvement.

261B8FD18E72446A89D65CB7AA4E4DE3.description: create and implement a personal physical fitness plan and analyze the results for effectiveness; and

9B55E12364D6400BB7AC4744271C49C0.description: Health, physical activity, and fitness--analyze data. The physically literate student demonstrates competency in the ability to analyze data used during fitness performance. The student is expected to:

103A48164D2D4452B5DAB072D1AC4E82.description: develop and analyze a personal fitness plan using health-related and skill-related fitness components.

A133AEB82A744D6087D40F8EB46366AD.description: perform basic frequency, intensity, time, and type (FITT) principle in a variety of self-selected aerobic and anaerobic activities; and

ABEECFE927CB4E1AA86F0DFD3DB688CA.description: perform a variety of lifelong physical activities and explain their effects on overall health and wellness;

5DA4C720957440CF80BE114736BF06B5.description: Health, physical activity, and fitness--fitness principles. The physically literate student demonstrates and recognizes a health-enhancing, physically active lifestyle. The student is expected to:

97CACA0183514FE39B04F4A4253530F7.description: Performance strategies--outdoor and recreational pursuits. The physically literate student demonstrates competency in outdoor and recreational pursuits. The student is expected to engage in a variety of self-selected outdoor recreational activities and games.

92D4A02A96A84336AA09AC0624773356.description: follow rules, demonstrate appropriate sporting behavior, self-officiate, and respect consequences for the game being played without cue.

CAC735AADB62422F8819BF65E33FB361.description: perform, without cue, combinations or sequences of game skills to achieve individual or team goals; and

2837CC4BE2E14E499103755498048BC6.description: perform, without cue, offensive and defensive strategies used in net or wall, invasion, target, striking, and fielding games and sports;

7853922AD2E84131A93DB40E38E0AE71.description: Performance strategies--games and activities. The physically literate student demonstrates competency in performance strategies in invasion, target, net or wall, fielding, striking, and cooperative games. The student is expected to:

171FA9CA2506408EB93BCC4B3D489A7F.description: Movement patterns and movement skills--rhythmic activities. The physically literate student demonstrates competency in rhythmic activities and rhythmic combinations. The student is expected to create and perform with a small group a rhythmic routine with varying tempos using advanced steps and movement patterns.

1C03F258B460440881F937C2CE3CC849.description: perform, without cue, the appropriate speed, direction, and force with or without an implement during dynamic activities, games, and sports.

978E196F461F47B0B71793A6BE70A430.description: perform, without cue, the appropriate use of open space and closing space during dynamic activities, games, and sports; and

8F935530F5CE4D9BABA30406B814F6CD.description: Movement patterns and movement skills--spatial and body awareness. The physically literate student demonstrates competency in spatial and body awareness, including pathways, shapes, levels, speed, direction, and force. The student is expected to:

9519B9E4D56A478BAB8656C78F77F809.description: create and perform a jump rope routine with a partner or a small group using a variety of skills that include agility, speed, and endurance.

7B4B52D733004DDDA9CF7C21DCFD06CB.description: perform, without cue, key elements in striking during game situations and sports; and

0B9D90F2EF2F49149A5880B0B3F55175.description: perform, without cue, key elements in volleying during game situations and sports;

B07C0C4756844149BBB91DDA94BE478B.description: apply correct technique in kicking and punting during game situations and sports with control, distance, and accuracy;

3E00A715148C478E9467A00F6FD4CF6E.description: perform, without cue, key elements in foot dribbling during game situations and sports;

B204D755AFCF4AAD8C2CAD4C38B76C80.description: perform, without cue, key elements in hand dribbling during game situations and sports;

1843987B19E64AA9800E8612C5AE9FA3.description: apply appropriate catching technique from different levels and trajectories with an implement during game situations and sports;

87BEEFFD1B8840F28FAC07278F351EAC.description: combine appropriate throwing techniques during game situations and sports;

84D9344F2E72462484A0E38A31DDBAA2.description: Movement patterns and movement skills--manipulative skills. The physically literate student demonstrates competency in developmentally appropriate manipulative skills. The student is expected to:

1B08A549CD814B4185AE51F80404B728.description: demonstrate proper body positioning, proficiency, and footwork and perform offensive and defensive skills during dynamic activities, game situations, and sports.

ED7E326AA2814B54AFD0525A9159D1B0.description: combine and apply balance with control during dynamic activities, game situations, and sports; and

19882D4551C24331AEECC8EBFF75DA64.description: Movement patterns and movement skills--non-locomotor skills. The physically literate student demonstrates competency in fundamental movement patterns and developmentally appropriate non-locomotor skills. The student is expected to:

AFE23E25A1284DE1863FDE57465EADB7.description: combine correct jumping and landing technique during dynamic activities, game situations, and sports.

E0193C8174ED4CE1B02EFEE3EA5BBD10.description: combine and apply a variety of locomotor skills during dynamic fitness, sport, and rhythmic activities; and

26C81DE4489146FB9DB769E413E884FC.description: Movement patterns and movement skills--locomotor skills. The physically literate student demonstrates competency in fundamental movement patterns and developmentally appropriate locomotor skills. The student is expected to:
